unnormalised: Delivery chaos in Bengaluru! Looks like half the city is facing delays. My friend, Rohan Sharma from Indiranagar, is still waiting for a package he ordered on 10/10/2024. The tracking says "Out for Delivery" since 8:00 AM, but no sign of it yet. Address is simply "Rohan Sharma, #42, 1st Main Road, Indiranagar, Bangalore, 560038."
normalised: Delivery chaos in Bengaluru! Looks like half the city is facing delays. My friend, Rohan Sharma from Indiranagar, is still waiting for a package he ordered on tenth october two thousand and twenty four. The tracking says "Out for Delivery" since eight a m, but no sign of it yet. Address is simply "Rohan Sharma, hash forty two, first Main Road, Indiranagar, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty thousand and thirty eight."

unnormalised: Courier companies blaming the monsoon and the crazy traffic, especially near Silk Board junction. Heard similar stories from others too. Apparently, even premium services like "SpeedPost" are affected. One person on Twitter complained about a delayed delivery to "Aparna Towers, Flat 204, Sarjapur Road, Bengaluru, 560035".
normalised: Courier companies blaming the monsoon and the crazy traffic, especially near Silk Board junction. Heard similar stories from others too. Apparently, even premium services like "S-P-E-E-D-P-O-S-T" are affected. One person on Twitter complained about a delayed delivery to "Aparna Towers, Flat two hundred and four, Sarjapur Road, Bengaluru, five hundred and sixty thousand and thirty five".

unnormalised: The local authorities are supposedly looking into it, but honestly, who knows when things will get back to normal? Guess we'll all just have to prepone our expectations for now. Meanwhile, someone please tell the delivery guys to check the house numbers properly! I’ve seen them go to #41 when the address is clearly #42! This happened to my neighbour Mrs. Iyer at "Iyer Nivas, 12 Cross, Malleshwaram, 560003" last week.
normalised: The local authorities are supposedly looking into it, but honestly, who knows when things will get back to normal? Guess we'll all just have to prepone our expectations for now. Meanwhile, someone please tell the delivery guys to check the house numbers properly! I’ve seen them go to hash forty one when the address is clearly hash forty two! This happened to my neighbour Missus Iyer at "Iyer Nivas, twelve Cross, Malleshwaram, five hundred and sixty thousand and three" last week.

unnormalised: Some are speculating the issues stem from the increased online shopping around the festive season, adding to the already strained infrastructure. Others believe the implementation of new traffic regulations around "Old Madras Road, KR Puram, Bengaluru, 560036" is contributing to the delays.
normalised: Some are speculating the issues stem from the increased online shopping around the festive season, adding to the already strained infrastructure. Others believe the implementation of new traffic regulations around "Old Madras Road, K-R Puram, Bengaluru, five hundred and sixty thousand and thirty six" is contributing to the delays.

unnormalised: "We regret any inconvenience caused," said a spokesperson from one of the major courier services. Yeah, easy for them to say! Try waiting for an important document that's supposed to arrive at "Central Business District, Richmond Road, 560025" before a deadline!
normalised: "We regret any inconvenience caused," said a spokesperson from one of the major courier services. Yeah, easy for them to say! Try waiting for an important document that's supposed to arrive at "Central Business District, Richmond Road, five hundred and sixty thousand and twenty five" before a deadline!

unnormalised: In the meantime, maybe try ordering from stores with local pickup options instead? At least then you can go grab it yourself from "Brigade Road, Shanti Nagar, Bangalore, 560001" and avoid the delivery drama. Stay strong, Bengaluru! Your packages will (hopefully) arrive... eventually.
normalised: In the meantime, maybe try ordering from stores with local pickup options instead? At least then you can go grab it yourself from "Brigade Road, Shanti Nagar, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty thousand and one" and avoid the delivery drama. Stay strong, Bengaluru! Your packages will (hopefully) arrive... eventually.

unnormalised: Reports are also coming in about address confusion, even when full addresses are used! Like "Asha Kiran Apartments, 5th Block, Jayanagar, 560041".
normalised: Reports are also coming in about address confusion, even when full addresses are used! Like "Asha Kiran Apartments, fifth Block, Jayanagar, five hundred and sixty thousand and forty one".
